name: Titanium.UI.SearchBar
summary: A specialized text field for entering search text.

events.name: focus
events.summary: Fired when the search bar gains focus.
events.description: This event only fires when using the trackball to navigate.

properties.name: value
properties.summary: Value of the search bar.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: blur
events.summary: Fired when the search bar loses focus.

properties.name: value
properties.summary: Value of the search bar.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: bookmark
events.summary: Fired when the bookmark button is pressed.

properties.name: value
properties.summary: Value of the search bar.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: cancel
events.summary: Fired when the cancel button is pressed.

properties.name: value
properties.summary: Value of the search bar.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: change
events.summary: Fired when the value of the search bar changes.

properties.name: value
properties.summary: Value of the search bar.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: return
events.summary: Fired when keyboard search button is pressed.

properties.name: value
properties.summary: Value of the search bar.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: blur
methods.summary: Causes the search bar to lose focus.

methods.name: focus
methods.summary: Causes the search bar to gain focus.

methods.name: insertTokenAtIndex
methods.summary: Inserts a new search token at the specified index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.summary: The index to insert the token at.

methods.name: removeTokenAtIndex
methods.summary: Removes an existing token at the specified index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.summary: The index to remove the token at.

methods.name: setShowCancel
methods.description:
Sets the value of the showCancel property.

On iOS, this method can be used to specify animation properties when changing the state of the cancel button.

searchBar.setShowCancel(true, { animated: true });

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary:
Dictionary of animation properties. Currently only a single boolean property, animated is supported. Only used on iOS.

Note that the default here is equivalent to passing in { animated: false }

properties.name: autocapitalization
properties.summary: Determines how text is capitalized during typing.

properties.name: autocorrect
properties.summary: Determines whether the text in the search bar is autocorrected during typing.

properties.name: barColor
properties.summary: Bar color of the search bar view, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description:
For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

On iOS and Android, barColor specifies the color of the "frame" around the search text field. On Windows, barColor specifies the color of the whole surrounding area of the search text field.

properties.name: cancelButtonTitle
properties.summary: The title of the cancel button when the search bar field is focused.
properties.description: Use this property if you want to display a custom cancel title.

properties.name: color
properties.summary: Color of the text in this text field, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: fieldBackgroundDisabledImage
properties.summary: Background image of the text field in disabled state, specified as a local file path or URL.
properties.description: If this property is not specified, the default white background is used.

properties.name: fieldBackgroundImage
properties.summary: Background image of the text field, specified as a local file path or URL.
properties.description: If this property is not specified, the default white background is used.

properties.name: focused
properties.summary: Determines whether this SearchBar has focus.

properties.name: hintText
properties.summary: Text to show when the search bar field is not focused.
properties.default: On iOS, System-localized 'Search'. On Android and Windows, no hint text.

properties.name: hintTextColor
properties.summary: Hint text color to display when the field is empty.
properties.default: The platform's default hint text color.

properties.name: hinttextid
properties.summary: Key identifying a string from the locale file to use for the hintText property.
properties.description: Only one of hintText or hinttextid should be specified.

properties.name: iconified
properties.summary: Collapses/expands the search view to/from a search icon.

properties.name: iconifiedByDefault
properties.summary: Set true show as a search icon that expands to a search view when tapped on.

properties.name: keyboardAppearance
properties.summary: Determines the appearance of the keyboard to be displayed the field is focused.

properties.name: keyboardType
properties.summary: Keyboard type constant to use when the field is focused.

properties.name: prompt
properties.summary: Single line of text displayed at the top of the search bar.
properties.description: On Android, this property is no longer supported as of Titanium 10.0.0.

properties.name: promptid
properties.summary: Key identifying a string from the locale file to use for the prompt property.
properties.description: On Android, this property is no longer supported as of Titanium 10.0.0.

properties.name: showBookmark
properties.summary: Determines whether the bookmark button is displayed.

properties.name: showCancel
properties.summary: Determines whether the cancel button is displayed.
properties.description: On iOS, you can specify that showing and hiding the cancel button should be animated. The change is not animated by default. To enable animation, call setShowCancel.

properties.name: style
properties.summary: Determines the style of the search bar.

properties.name: tokens
properties.summary: The token of a search text field

properties.name: value
properties.summary: Value of the search bar.
properties.description: On Android and before Titanium 10.0.0, the value cannot be set until after the search bar is created.
